Reviews.Title: “clean and central”
Reviews.Author: chineseswede
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to bars, restaurants and shops. Clean room. The brekkie was shocking. Might as well not include it. Housekeeping staff was noisy and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Central hub, comfy and clean”
Reviews.Author: tinaross
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night here this week and was satisfied with our short stay ..first impressions were not good, no welcome, very mundane business like attitudes from reception staff. But I guess we are not here to make new friends with hotel staff so we overlooked this. Perfect location, centre of everything, walking distance to shops, restaurants, and even train station. Room was comfortable and clean, hot water was a bit of a problem, took ages to get warm. After researching places to stay, The Minden appeared a better alternative than many in terms of value. Prices in Hong Kong are outrageously high unless you want to stay in a tiny little box, the room at The Minden, was reasonable price in comparison to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Chinababe08
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that is is a review based on a short stay as I moved out of this hotel on th first night due to the excessive amount of noise coming from the nightclub in the street below. The staff gave me another room which wasn't much better, so as I hadn't unpacked I left for another hotel. It must be said the staff were very kind and helped me find another hotel and called a cab, just an unfortunate location. Otherwise the rooms seemed clean and relatively spacious for Hong Kong. It's also hard to find, even with instructions in Chinese and calling the hotel my driver had some trouble finding it.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Joy_Lim7
Reviews.Content: Read good reviews about Minden and decided to booked it for my trip in May. Have a pleasant 2 night stay there. 1) Counter staff - friendly, helpful and polite. 2) Room - decent size, clean, comfortable bed and good size bathroom.They even placed an air purifer in the room which I counted as a bonus. 3) Breakfast - limited and basic spread with items like bread, eggs, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee and tea. 4) Location - near K12 Mall and less than 5 min walk to East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. Thus can hop on the MTR to visit shopping malls and places of interest easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, clean & helpful”
Reviews.Author: shedden2u
Reviews.Content: Cost us about $400 CYN taxi from airport (inc the toll fees). The place is a few blocks to shops in main street. Few bars and clubs in street, and a handy 711 below. Rooms are small but thats normal here. Its clean and tidy. Take a print of map so taxi can find hotel as its a little side street. Breakfast is basic but ok. Would reccomend for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and well located”
Reviews.Author: SA-Safari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Minden in April 2012. We were visiting the Canton Fair in nearby Guangzhou and decided to travel to Hong Kong over the weekend inbetween phases. We stayed there on two occasions. The Minden has about 20 floors and about 4 rooms per floor. The 1st time we went, we were on the 6th floor. The second time on the 18th (we could even see a bit of the harbour from here). I preffered to be higher up as the night clubs in the street can be a bit noisy. The hotel is very centrally situated and easily accessible. It is a 5 min walk away from the Star Ferry terminal which you can use to visit Hong Kong Island. It is also close to many markets (a 3 min taxi ride). There is a 24 hour store next door to the hotel which is very convenient. Buy your drinks/water from here as the water in the hotel is very very expensive. The rooms are nice, clean and quite modern. Each room has a flat screen TV and a bar fridge. The ensuite bathrooms are small but exactly what you need. I heard that hotel rooms in Hong Kong is generally quite small; even this was also small it was bigger than I expected. There is also a work desk in each room. Every room also has FREE broadband internet which is a rarity in HK. The comlimentary fruit basket was such a delight after some weird meals in mainland China. The hotel includes a complimentary breakfast which consists of fruit, coffee/juice, boiled eggs, toast, yoghurt, and pastries. Breakfast is served in the restaurant which has a lovely little outside terrace. You can also order room service but not all the items are available so check with the kitchen. The hotel also offers a luggage storage facility if you need to book out but still want to sightsee. I really reccommend this hotel as it is good value for money in a very expensive city and the staff was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Colin T
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice budget boutique hotel in an excellent location. It is very near to MTR exits both for TST/East TST. If coming down from Airport, take the Airport Express train to Kowloon, then the complementary airport shuttle (K3) and alight at the first stop - Holiday Inn. The Minden is just like 2 mins walk away. There are also a couple of nice pubs and many restaurants in the vicinity. Only thing I found lacking, was the absence of good local food around the area. They could also have spiced up their breakfast menu to give it a change everyday instead of the same fare every single day.

Reviews.Title: “In the mid of Kowloon (Near Nathan Road)”
Reviews.Author: UpeJakarta
Reviews.Content: For me, this hotel is more than enough as a place to stay when you're in Kowloon part of Hong Kong. Near all the public transportation stops, many shops and stalls. The hotel also clean and provide good services. The room is reasonably efficient. Not as big as you think, but there was still a place to put your big luggage and other things. Definitely not a shoe box hotel. I spent 2 nights in this hotel, and quite impressed and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoLJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Minden for two nights and found it very clean and comfortable. It was well located within easy access to ferries and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: wyatthawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night - location wasn't too bad really. Breakfast was great! We were upgraded to a deluxe room on the tenth floor and the size was good for Hong Kong... BUT the bed was terrible! It felt like we were sleeping on the box springs, not the mattress! If we had stayed any longer I would have made a issue out of it. Otherwise the staff was very helpful and they kept our bags before and after check-out with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lucy j
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend. The hotel is really nicely decorated and feels really homely. The bedrooms are very comfortable, with good facilities. Everything was very clean. The breakfast was delicious, with a wide selection available.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by telling you what are my expectations of good hotel: Safe, clean bathroom, & clean and comfortable bed. Anything else is welcomed but not essential for me. This hotel meets my criteria and exceeds it in some aspects but also falls behind in a little of things. Let's start with the location; From the MTR station TST it is as close as it gets for the low price range, if you take the K11 mall exit you only have to cross the street and hotel is just around the corner. This is a plus in my book, and also the street where the hotel is is almost full of bars/restaurants which comes very handy if you are in fact looking to have a drink or two and then stumble back to your room. Now this is a double edge sword, because with all these bars comes noise at night and if you are a light sleeper, then ask for a higher floor room or a quiet facing the back of the hotel (a little research goes A LONG WAY) My complaint with noise was in the early morning when the bars get rid of hundreds of beer bottles you can hear the noise for several minutes in what I assume is a recycling truck, very disturbing if you plan to sleep in for the morning. Now a positive point is the free in room internet, very rare in Hong Kong and came in very handy, totally makes up for the morning noise (I had to wake up for work anyways) and if you bring a travel Wifi router you will have yourself a personal office in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui! another minor annoyance is the lack of complementary water, they have 2 bottles inside your room but they charge 60HKD for each, most hotels will gladly provide you with a small bottle or two of generic water. Again, no big deal as there is a 7 Eleven just down the street. They will provide power adapters free of charge at check in which is also very nice of them as well as an Ethernet cable for your laptop connection (hardwired) and another quick tip if you need to iron your clothes ask for an ironing board in advance as they will provide it to you free of charge, but upon request. Some people may find the beds to be in the stiff side, I did not have a problem with it but please do yourself a favor and not dive into the bed you will thank me for this tip. Other in room amenities, are in room safe (big enough to fit a laptop and a SLR camera) TV (non flat screen) with cable and in room AC/HEATER system. There is a mini fridge with room to spare for your own drinks but I did not use it. Personnel are very attentive and nice, I have no complaints at all, my check in was really fast as well as checking out which is at noon, also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: elaineeyyy
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a breeze. We got there way before the 2pm check in time, but no problems whatsoever with leaving our luggage in their storage until we got back from our 1st round of shopping at around 5pm. Front desk staff were easy to talk to and very helpful (without even asking, they offered an adapter for our chargers, assisted us with locating places easily, etc.). The hotel is just a very short walk from the trains, ferry terminal and of course, all the shops and restaurants in Tsim Sha Tsui (it's just behind The Peninsula and Sheraton). Very safe street on which The Minden is located, Minden Ave. It reminded me of the West Village in New York, with the bars and restaurants that line it. This impression is just for this particular street, though. The Minden Hotel's Room 702 was simple but very comfortable; the bed fit two perfectly. The mattress may be a little bit too firm for some but totally okay with us. Sheets and pillows were clean (and smelled that way). I was surprised too, at how comfortable the pillows were, considering this is just a 3-star hotel. Prior to the trip, I read about the poorly soundproofed walls. This didn't bother me until our last morning. It was still to my advantage because I was really supposed to wake up early... and I did, thanks to the noisy family waiting for the elevator. My friend didn't hear anything, though. We had a clean, well lit and spacious bathroom with only one downside: it got quite cold because of outside air that seeped through the window (even when closed) on one side of the shower stall... survivable, though. Not sure if it would still be if it were a colder time (we were there 2nd week of January). Breakfast, served at Courtney's on the 5th floor, made my day! I loved their blueberry danish and coffee! Sausage roll is quite good, too! I enjoyed eating in this small but nicely decorated area. While the spread is limited to hard boiled egg, toast, plain croissant, danish (plain, blueberry and another fruit), sausage roll, cereal, fruits and yoghurt, orange juice, coffee and tea, heavy eaters will appreciate that they may eat to their heart's content. I rated Average for "Value" because their rates were steeper than other 3-star hotels in the TST area (especially during the super peak season we were in), but I'm still happy we settled for The Minden. The room, breakfast, location and service made it worth their price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,”
Reviews.Author: gab11_11
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel in Kowloon adjacent to all local attractions. The staff made this stay exceptional. The hotel is small but clean. Short walk to the Star Ferry. Continental breakfast was great. Exceptional staff ! Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mlfranklin
Reviews.Content: Even though I rate The Minden average, I would definitely recommend it to friends and coworkers. The deal I got through TripAdvisor and Expedia made it well worth the money for the area of Kowloon it's in. The Minden has a helpful and polite staff, is clean, and is a great value, especially considering what the others in the area charge. The location is very good - an easy walk to the Star Ferry, to shopping, to the waterfront walk, the Peninsula Hotel, and much more. Some might not like that it is located behind Chungking Mansions, but I don't find that a problem at all. Good job, Minden staff!

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location ... decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: avidbnbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with this hotel back Aug. The hotel is pretty decent with all basic ameneties. Few things I noted though. No bell boy service to carry your luggage when you check-in. B'fast is just about decent not good. There's a few pubs around the hotel so gets a bit noisy on the weekends. I had read about this already so I got myself a higher floor. The only caveat is Wi-fi works on the lower floors only. They have the usual LAN cable though so if you have a laptop, you're covered. Rooms are decent sized but no Ironing board provided in the room. I had to call the reception to get an Ironing board which they gave very promptly. The pillows were too flat, so I asked for extras but since it was weekend rush, so they didnot have any. Tough luck. Service is fast. About the location, very very near to TST(E) MTR and some of the good attractions like the Star ferry, Avenue of stars, Salisbury etc. Another good thing is transport to airport, this place has tons of taxis/minivans right below the hotel. So you can bargain quick and skip the hassle of booking a taxi in advance. One thing I really didn't like about the location of this hotel was the walk from hotel to TST E Mtr. You have to pass through some of the backyards of hotels/restaurants etc and you'd see either hotel staff or random people sitting around the corners, smoking and stuff. I would've just avoided that route if I could but that was the shortest route to the MTR. Bottom line, I would opt. for YMCA Salisbury any day provided they have vaccancies. But for the price you pay Minden is definitely a very good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: chongbrood
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel came highly recommended in the Lonely Planet. We booked it for three nights and were not disappointed. The rooms were not very large but adequately sized and comfortable. The breakfast was just serviceable but then HK has lots of great places to eat and I would not mind not taking the hotel's breakfast. The public areas were small but then, this is HK and space is a premium. My room had a slight view of HK harbour. The location was great with the MTR just a couple of metres away. It is also near enough to walk to the Avenue of the Stars. For shopping, Carnavon and Kimberly Sts were not far to walk to either. All in, its worth the money in terms of comfort after a long day of shopping and sightseeing, a haven in Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointing”
Reviews.Author: goldfingers
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as our favourite HK hotel was not available. Thought I did the right thing by booking and paying for a "Deluxe Queen" size room with Agoda. What a disappointment! We arrived in the early afternoon and my heart sank already when I saw the neighbourhood and then had to drag our cases into the lobby ourselves. No doorman or any assistance. We were given a very dinghy, dark and smelly room on the 6th floor facing the street. As it is not our habit to complain, we just accepted it. Room size was reasonable for HK. General location was very good (that's why I chose The Minden in the first place). Near MTR and K11 Shopping Mall and hundreds of small shops, eateries etc all around. But then the noise from the night-clubs , that had been mentioned by other reviewers, started. It was unbelievably loud and really unacceptable. They should have triple-glazing !! Besides, the window in the bathroom is not double-glazed and although we kept the bathroom door closed, there was no escape from the racket. The following nights were better - thank goodness. (Or perhaps I had got used to it?) The bathroom was very well functioning with a nice shower and enough room to move. Although I am used to hard beds all over China, these are ridiculously hard! The oldfashioned bulky TV set surprised us in the otherwise high-tech minded HK. The included breakfast was for us the best aspect of the hotel. There is a nice outdoor area as well which you can escape to if the 6 airconditioning units in the b'fast room freeze you to death. :) I loved the artwork throughout the hotel but can not possibly recommend the Minden Hotel to my friends and only because it's small, it's not a "Boutique Hotel" in my book. And I still wonder, if we were actually given a Deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected..”
Reviews.Author: DinahBKK
Reviews.Content: Booked Minden via Agoda.com but upon seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor, I became really scared! The hotel was nothing fancy but the location was great -- very near the MTR and the staff are very very accommodating. All my requests were granted, pronto! I even overslept on my last day and only checked out at least two hours after the check-out time. They didn't charge me extra!

Reviews.Title: “too loud!”
Reviews.Author: harbrsl
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a friday night and it was a decent price for Kowloon. however, it's located near loud restaurants and bars. it's also really hard to find in those roads east of nathan road so getting to and from was a challenge. the bed was crazy hard. the staff was helpful and the continental breakfast had nice variety but overall, it was not a good experience. i wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, tacky hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ivyleague100
Reviews.Content: Located opposite a bar & disco, it was impossible to sleep from 3:00 am to 6:00 am. The front desk explained Tuesday and weekends are bad because it's Ladies night and so the bars are busier. The road is narrow and a dead end and perfect for bar patrons to sit on the street and scream and blow their car horns every time they drive away. The road is very narrow and sound bounces off the buildings. The staff are nice people, but weary of complaints. The hotel is dingy and tatty. I had booked 2 nights and requested a high floor when I arrived. I was offered the 20th floor but the room smelt so bad - like an old ashtray - and so a non-smoking room on the 10th floor was recommended. Breakfast is included with the room and consists of toast, cornflakes and half-boiled egg. That's all there is available to eat. Tables are bare - no cutlery, napkins or condiments. You have to lay your own table. No service at all. The Minden is a huge disappointment. It isn't a hotel - it's a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lee083
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to shopping areas, good eateries and the waterfront. An easy few minutes walk to watch the Symphony of the lights down on the waterfront overlooking Hong Kong island. Our room on the 17th floor was quiet, modern, spacious, well appointed & the pillows the most comfortable we had in our 3 week trip in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “1) Location. 2) Location. 3) Location.”
Reviews.Author: go14677
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about its location. Literally one minute walk away from an East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station (N3). The room was small, but comfortable. Very basic. For what we needed (a bed and a hot shower after a long day) it was more than enough. What you really pay for is how well situated it is. They call themselves "Hong Kong's Leading Boutique Hotel"; I certainly wouldn't say it is a boutique hotel, I rather say it is a truly convenient place to stay in HK. I trust others' reviews here in TripAdvisor and always check before going anywhere. The bed was very firm, true, but not uncomfortable at all. There are several bars in Minden Ave, they could get loud until late, so if you are a light sleeper you might want to ask for a room in the upper floors. Breakfast is very basic as well, but if a croissant + half-done egg + coffee or cereal it's enough to jump-start your day like me, it is OK. Don't expect a fancy continental breakfast here. Wi-Fi internet is available in the 1st floor and they also have a couple of PCs you can use. Again, fair enough for us. Minden Ave is a hidden lane parallel to Mody Road. Until you orientate yourself in the area it could be a little tricky, so be sure to have a map with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & decor, but hard beds and noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: claudia023
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days during a stop over in HK. THe hotel is in a great location, near to the tube line and quick to access all of the key attractions. One thing to note, when travelling from the airport on the express train, is not to get off at Kowloon and take the free bus as suggested, but if you have luggage you can manage, better and far faster to get off at HK island which is the Central station and then it's less than five mins on one tube, rather than being stuck in traffic overground for 45 mins. The staff at the hotel were friendly and approachable, but as you'll have read on other reviews, the beds are hard - not unbearable, but not the most comfortable. It's also worht asking to be as high up as possible, as the clubs on the street have people outside until the early hours. Alhtough as we were completely jet lagged neither of these particularly bothered us as we couldn't sleep anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy.”
Reviews.Author: MagillaNYC
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel got such a good recommendation from Lonely Planet. It's not terrible, but we had such a bad experience there. The price for the rooms is pretty low for Hong Kong and it is a nice looking hotel. The room was clean and the lounge with computers for guests to use was nice, as was the breakfast room. But the mattress was so hard it was really difficult to sleep on. We asked if there was another room or mattress or even a foam mattress pad available, but were told no. They suggested another comforter that we could sleep on top of, but then never provided it. The neighborhood is a little dicey at night (and this is coming from someone who grew up in New York City), though no one bothered us. There was a line of mini-vans parked on the street most nights with a bunch of drivers who hung out there late at night and gave my girlfriend elevator eyes. There are several bars and a club on the block and the first night it got so loud on the street below that it woke us up on the tenth floor. On the second night the hot water stopped working after a minute in the shower. There may have just been something loose in the handle, but I asked to have it looked at and it was working the next night. The rooms have a switch for the hot water heater so you do have to leave time for it to heat up when you get to your room. The breakfast is minimal: toast, danish, mini croissant, coffee, tea, and I think there was cold cereal. I really wasn't expecting much for the price but not being able to get a consistent hot shower and a decent night's sleep made for a really bad experience. If it wasn't for their cancellation policy and the limited time we had in Hong Kong, I would have checked us out and gotten a more expensive room anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Its the best thing.”
Reviews.Author: Biker-Rafter
Reviews.Content: Location was very good as its in TST. However, I didnt rate it as 5 star as there are other better locations and the hotel is located beside some pubs. Not sure what was happening during the check iin though since I was promised a complimentary room upgrade to deluxe, after their standard rooms was full. It seemed to be a standard room which I was given though. So dont bother wasting your money to upgrade the rooms when the deluxe room and the standand room seemed so similar. Musty smell is there but its bearable to me. Personally, there are worse things than a musty smell originating from the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Gdawg3000
Reviews.Content: The Minden Hotel is the best value I've found in Hong Kong. It is extremely well located right near Tsim Sha Shui East Station in the heart of Kowloon. The Hotel is very nice, the rooms are great and the internet is free. The rooms are very quiet but the beds are very hard and the pillows a little thin. But you will be hard pressed to find a cheaper hotel in this area. I've stayed at the Kowloon Hotel for about the same price but it can't come close to the Minden. I'll be staying there from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - maybe worth it if you pay more”
Reviews.Author: Mafiti
Reviews.Content: We chose the Minden because it was the "our pick" option in the Lonely Planet. We wanted somewhere affordable, value for money as we knew that hotels in Hong Kong can be over-priced with tiny rooms. We went for the standard double at an online price of HK$800 per night with breakfast included. They always whack a 10% service charge on top. The Positives: -the room was a good size, fairly big for Hong Kong, by all accounts. -free broadband internet via ethernet cable provided by hotel (no wireless). -great location in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui without the noise of Nathan Road. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby -easy to get to from the airport: take bus A21 to TST and walk about 5 minutes. $33 for a single journey, a lot cheaper than the express airport bus. Why we won't be returning: -the room stank. We thought something had died. Really really unpleasant. I've read another review where someone also mentions the smell, so obviously not a one-off. -breakfast was pretty dire, certainly not my definition of continental. Better than a lot of places in China, yes, but at a very, very, very basic level. At least it was free, I guess. -we were given a voucher for a free drink from the hotel bar on arrival. We went to the bar to claim it only to find that it meant literally ONE drink. We were two people staying in a double room - pardon me for presuming that we'd get a drink each. We got two teeny tiny beers and had to pay $55 for one of them (didn't find out till we tried to leave). The wording on the voucher does not make it clear. -we asked to change rooms because of the smell. The completely personality free receptionist told us they were full, but I knew there were rooms available in the next price bracket (deluxe double for about $100 HK dollars more) and would have expected her to either upgrade us at no extra cost or to give us a discount on our room. In conclusion - an awful room, but there has to be something good about this place because some other people liked it and the Lonely Planet picked it out from all the others. I can only presume that the more expensive rooms are better, so pay more and you might get more.

Reviews.Title: “Actually non-smoking rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Elle32
Reviews.Content: Negative sides first: - The bed and pillow were like rocks! I had read that about the bed before I arrived but my lord it was worse than I thought. I woke up in the middle of the night with a sore ear from the insanely lumpy/hard pillow. - No free wireless Internet in the room. There is a function room on level 5 though that has two computers and access, incl chairs and toilets. - The fan in my bathroom leaked water. nothing major but still. - No full size mirror in the room. But go out in the corridor to the elevators, there are some. Positive sides: - All the personnel was very friendly. Reception tried to get a room for me even if I arrived at 8 am and check-in was 2 pm. The luggage man rushed to get my bags every time. - Breakfast was included in the price - My non-smoking room actually did not smell of smoke! - The size of the room was very normal, I had the feeling that rooms in HK are small according to other reviews but this was just ... normal. - Very close to metro, shopping areas, harbour, food, everything. - If you take the express train to/from the airport a hotel shuttle is included. Take the K3 line and jump off/on at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. The Minden is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel! good location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsOng
Reviews.Content: My father-in-law's friend booked us at this hotel (at his expense) coz he invited us to visit HK! It's a very nice boutique hotel and located in the heart of Kowloon! You can tell that it's not a cheap hotel because of its location.. i guess i'm glad we didn't spend a buck for accommodation! It's walking distance to a lot of Malls, stores and restaurant... We didn't have to take the MTR to go places because everything is walking distance! I think the only thing i didn't like about this boutique hotel is their breakfast! i know it's free, so i shouldn't complain--but they only offer cereal, toast, muffins, croissant, coffee and juice.. the staff was nice too.. coz they lend us umbrella when it rained.. when you call for a question or request for something they replied promptly.. free internet too! but you have to ask for a wire so you can connect! it's not wi-fi.. Overall, if i get a chance to go back to Kowloon HK, i would like to go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “cute and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: principessa_m
Reviews.Content: clean cute rooms, very good service. we arrived very late and chose it because our hostels proved to be the most dodgy and dirty place ever. we were very tired and did not have any expectations and we got really pleasantly surprised. for the people that havent been to hong kong - it is very hard to get relatively cheap accommodation there since all the hostels are really dirty, ugly and stinky... Minden could be a compromise, however it is not located on the Honk Kong Island... the best thing about this hotel is the restaurant terrace where you can have breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: nataliegoes
Reviews.Content: The Minden seemed like the perfect place for us...a reasonably priced boutique hotel in the part of Kowloon we wanted to be. We found it quickly, check in went well and we arrived at our compact room without a lot of frill, but clean and decently decorated. But the musty smell was worse than your great grandmothers basement. And the bed was harder than sleeping on the floor. Chinese beds are notoriously uncomfortable, but this was even harder than usual. But the smell nearly kept me from sleeping. Even in the morning, after haven had the air conditioning going all night, the odor could knock you over. We suspect that not all the rooms are like this, we were probably just unlucky. Nonetheless, we shan't be returning. With a place like Hong Kong with hundreds of Hotels to choose from, we think we can do better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel with an awesome bar”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel for the price. It was fairly good value for what I paid. The check in was helpful. very small elevator. The street the hotel is located on is quite lively at night meaning it can be a bit loud. It was in a kinda dodgy area but never felt unsafe. Room was small but that's to be expected in HK. The bathroom was very clean. Once you walk in, it was a little bit moldy smelling but after turning on the a/c the air in the room was much better. Overall I was happy with my choice. Loved the bar. It was definitely the best part of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't make a pig out of a sow's ear.”
Reviews.Author: Chinahighway
Reviews.Content: This hotel calls itself a 'boutique hotel', but it is nothing special really. It is in a tall thin building which is 20 stories high but only 4 rooms wide. It has a separate bar which doesn't seem much frequented, and the rooms are so-so for the price. The first one I saw smelled of mould, and all the fire sprinkler pipes were exposed in the ceiling, and rather dusty. The second was OK if you left the aircon on permanently, but the lavatory produced some pretty odd smells. Breakfast was perfunctory. Not a bad place, but not really worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: paulguangzhouchina
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 6 different hotels in the TST area (from the Chungking Mansions to the Sheraton), and the Minden was definitely the best value option. I've stayed at the Minden probably 5 - 6 times over the past 3 years. The location is very convenient-- the MTR, KCR (Hung Hom), Star ferry, Nathan Road, & Knutsford Terrece are all a short walk away. It is not a luxurious place, but the rooms are modern & stylish. I’ve always found the staff to be helpful, though checking in & out can be a bit slow. Overall, for the very reasonable rates charged, I’ve not found a better value in the area. If you only have one weekend in Hong Kong, go ahead and splurge-- stay at the Peninsula or something. But if you’re a frequent visitor, or just need a reasonably-priced base for exploring Hong Kong, the Minden is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: salthound
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Minden several times this year and each time it has been the usual, reliable hotel and the cost has been real value for money ( a difficult thing to find in Hong Kong). The rooms are not large but they have all the facilities that you need on a business trip, internet, desk to work at and comfortable bed. The location of the hotel is ok, on the slightly seedier side of Kowloon but it is close to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and from there the whole of Hong Kong is available. Also you can walk to the Star Ferry and other points of interest. I would propose to use the Minden for each of my visits to Hong Kong and I also recommend it strongly to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paloma34
Reviews.Content: The Minden was okay.... The main positives are it's location, right at the bottom of Kowloon, just off Nathan Road and the price of its rooms (around £90 a night for a standard room). The room was perfectly adequate and nicely decorated although the beds are quite hard. The main disadvantage for us was that our room faced onto Minden Avenue with its many clubs and bars and we had quite a lot of noise during the three nights we stayed. Not what you need when you are dealing with jet lag! Breakfast was a bit uninspiring, toast and jam, and one type of muffin as well as juice and coffee. However you could order a full cooked breakfast for $50, although I never saw anyone with one. The outside terrace in the bar is very pleasant and we were given a voucher for a free drink (which we eventually took upstairs as we were the only people in the bar!). All in all, a perfectly adequate hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Minden”
Reviews.Author: dglee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over Christmas and found this hotel to be adequate. Hotels can be pretty expensive in HK and you rarely get value for money unless you're paying £150 plus a night. I've previously stayed in two YMCA's - the better of the two is the Salisbury YMCA overlooking the harbour but you have to book well in advance to secure a room. Given we didn't want to pay a whole lot of money for accommodation, we opted for the Minden - which, at the end of the day, we got what we paid for. The hotel was modern and clean (I agree the reception staff were crap but the bar staff in the brilliant 5th floor bar were great and very polite) but the room we were given was on the small side - which isn't unusual for HK hotels. The bars on the other side of the road are not seedy (despite what an earlier review says) but are ultra trendy bars to have a drink - take advantage of the 2-1 but remember it only counts if you each order a full priced drink). I agree about the noise levels after dark though - very very noisy - we had to buy ear plugs to drown out the noise to get some sleep! Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again. YMCA Salisbury is the best value for money if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Much better options available”
Reviews.Author: youngandfiftyish
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a conveniently placed hotel in Kowloon and this was fine location for getting about. However it's in a seedy street with late night clubs and bars and even on the 20th floor we were surprised at the level of noise until 5.00 am each night. We agree with many contributors in that the service in reception and the bar/breakfast room was completely disinterested. We had a suite on the 20th floor which, whilst a reasonable size, was a little shabby and not well equipped. We liked the location of the bar/breakfast room on the 5th floor with it's open air area. Overall we found that this hotel would be more suitable to business stays rather than holidays. In value for money we found it expensive for what we had. We stayed in the Lanson Place on our return and paid HK$ 100 extra for a hugely better experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: choppers99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to public transport etc. I found the hotel staff to be very pleasant, opening doors and answering any questions I had .... with a smile. The beds are extremely hard!! Even though there are bars in the street I didn't hear any noise but I wasn't there during the weekend, not sure if that would make any difference.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dozzer
Reviews.Content: The Minden provided very good value for Hong Kong hotels. The location was very good and was close to MTR, KCR, and subway to the Museum and waterfront promenade. They pride themselves on the standard of housekeeping and daily service is very good. The included continental breakfast, coffee and toast, was okay and all I needed for a start to the day. The optional full American breakfast was not expensive but nothing much to remember, not recommended. I found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. They were willing to loan power adaptors and cables. They helpfully wrote down directions in Chinese for taxi drivers. They do not provide a concierge function, but I felt it was enough for the modest tariff paid. A tip; we went for a deluxe room which meant it was higher up (even had a tiny water view between buildings) which probably helped keep it quieter. Minden avenue is an emerging nightclub strip (upmarket though) and would get filled with taxis in the wee hours after the MTR shuts down. Oh, and the bed was VERY hard although we got used to that. I would stay here again if I wanted to be based in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hartfd
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. It is two minutes to the nearest MTR exit and close to almost everything a tourist could ask for. It is also clean. The toilet is not fancy but its got nice finishings. It was value for money. The service is not all that great. But then again, good service is not synonymous with Hong Kong, in general. The front desk was somewhat sarcastic when I asked them some questions. However I have seen a couple of really troublesome tourists (for eg. one customer who threw his credit card at the front desk staff) and so I can understand why they need to be a little aggressive at times even though I do not think this is a sufficient reason to be rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but horrible service - will never return again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thailand_Hotelier
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit at the hotel - from the previous year - and as much as the location is ideal; near MTR, train, ferry as well as having many taxi's available, the horrible service - or rather "no service" will stop me from returning to The Minden. It is a indeed a very cute boutique styled 3 star hotel and could be great... if not for the "robot-like" front desk staff... where a smile is too much and even any additional information seems to be too much. However what totally spoiled our 3 nights stay was our last night at The Minden, where we were rudely awoken by some trying to open our room door at 3:45am - luckily we placed the ledge on, but still couldn't get back to sleep.... and had requested a 5:30am wake up call the same morning due to our early flight... and we never received the call!!! Luckily we sat our own alarm, as we would have surely missed our flight. Having brought these problems/incidents to the managements attention, would have expected a clear response + apology, but the only correspondence received back was a "generic answer"... These experiences have left a very sour taste and unfortunately would not return + neither recommend this hotel... there are much better places around in HK!

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: jeswant
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel.Well located, most places in Tsim Shat Sui are a short walk from this hotel. Don't expect the ambience of 5 star hotels but if you are looking for a clean,homely place this hotel is good value.A simple continental breakfast is included and you have the option to upgrade to a hearty American breakfast for HKD 50.Rooms are small but clean .The bathrooms are very clean too.Functional with nothing fancy.Can connect to internet in your room.Staff speak reasonably good english....atleast as well as in some of the far more expensive Hong Kong hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: urban_faith134
Reviews.Content: It has quite a good location with the kowloon "lan kwai fong" below, it has a quite yet not deserted feel. The staff is quite polite and they always clean up our room after we came back from outside. The room is clean although not very big. The most different is that they provide continental breakfast for guests for free as we know hong kong hotel do not provide breakast for guest.. as least for free.. They have shuttle bus outside that shuttle us to the kowloon express and is near to all the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: vellum
Reviews.Content: business trip, stayed for one night on arrival before travelling to china. free shuttle bus to the hotel from kowloon station if travel from airport by airport express. fantastic location in the centre of tsim sha tsui, in the middle of all public transport but set back away from main roads, so easy enough to travel anywhere and quiet enough to sleep. small boutique hotel without much facility, only one reception staff and a security/ door man, they were both very friendly. no problem at all when check in and check out. clear and modern interiors, reasonable sized room, much bigger than those in central london. comfortable bed, basic bathroom with shower unit, all basic facilities included in room - tea/ coffee, kettle, slippers, shower/ shampoo, soap, toothbrush, tooth paste, stationary, etc. free local calls including mobile calls. on the down side, there is no socket to plug in electrical toothbrush/ shaver. nathan road is just two minutes walk, there are lots of banks, restaurants, shops, hairdressers, 24 hr convenient shops, everything is within walking distance. travelling to china by train is also very easy from the hotel, just walk a couple of minutes to tsim sha tsui underground station, follow the sign and walk a further few minutes in air-conditioned super clean tunnel and will arrive tsim sha tsui east train station. or take a taxi to hung hom train station for express train to china.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: rc3hk
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 superior twin rooms. The rooms are clean and simple design. Toilet is a bit bare. It is in a good location and easily accessed to all the shopping area around TST. However, the front desk staff at night is horribly rude and useless (there is only 1 desk). Will never stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Xi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.7 Minden Avenue, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China (Formerly The Minden Hotel)
